column4: where i can found my kernel sources...and how can i recompile it ?
look for linux-source in synaptic
at /usr/src i have only rpm dir
how can i install it ?
as I said, look in synaptic for linux-source
ok i'll do that
why do you need the source, by the way?
what are you compiling?
i'm trying to install VMware Workstation.....
running the configure script output that my kernel is compiled in an later version of the gcc i have now
so i will recompile it in the latest version
hmmmmm i'll try that....
so do i..heheh...
right....i'm getting the hearders....
i get the linux-headers i run the export CC=gcc-3.4....just that ?
sorry that was for you
the export command will apply only to the shell you are running BTW
i run the script again...and output the same msg ...that the kernel was compiled with other gcc version
did you run your commands immediately after the export command?
*cough* have you installed  build-essential  ?
if not, do so
ah, good :)
